content:
TITLE: Implementing Alternative Indexing with XSLT Import/Include Pattern
DESCRIPTION: Example code showing how to create a customization layer for DocBook XSL that implements the alternative indexing mechanism with better internationalization support. This snippet demonstrates importing the base stylesheet and including the new indexing code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-22/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"
                    version="1.0">

<xsl:import href="http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/fo/docbook.xsl"/>
<xsl:include href="http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/fo/autoidx-ng.xsl"/>

</xsl:stylesheet>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing DocBook FO Stylesheet with New Indexing in XSLT
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a customization layer that imports the base DocBook FO stylesheet and includes the new indexing code for better internationalization support. It allows grouping of accented letters and special character handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"
                version="1.0">

<xsl:import href="http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/fo/docbook.xsl"/>
<xsl:include href="http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/fo/autoidx-ng.xsl"/>

</xsl:stylesheet>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Saxon Transformation Command for Windows-1252 Encoding
DESCRIPTION: Java command line examples for invoking Saxon with Windows-1252 encoding configuration. Shows both basic and detailed command versions with XML resolver settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-22/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
java \
  -Dencoding.windows-1252=com.nwalsh.saxon.Windows1252 \
com.icl.saxon.StyleSheet \
mydoc.xml mystylesheet.xsl
```

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
java \
  -Dencoding.windows-1252=com.nwalsh.saxon.Windows1252 \
  -Djavax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory=org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl \
  -Djavax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory=org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserFactoryImpl \
  -Djavax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory=com.icl.saxon.TransformerFactoryImpl \
com.icl.saxon.StyleSheet \
  -x org.apache.xml.resolver.tools.ResolvingXMLReader \
  -y org.apache.xml.resolver.tools.ResolvingXMLReader \
  -r org.apache.xml.resolver.tools.CatalogResolver \
mydoc.xml mystylesheet.xsl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Windows-1252 Encoding XSLT Customization for HTML Help Generation
DESCRIPTION: This XSL stylesheet customization enables Windows-1252 character encoding when generating HTML Help content with Saxon. It imports the DocBook XSL HTML Help stylesheets and sets encoding parameters specifically for Western European language support.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: xsl
CODE:
```
<xsl:stylesheet
  xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"
  version='1.0'>
  <xsl:import href="http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/htmlhelp/htmlhelp.xsl"/>
  <xsl:output method="html" encoding="WINDOWS-1252" indent="no"/>
  <xsl:param name="htmlhelp.encoding" select="'WINDOWS-1252'"></xsl:param>
  <xsl:param name="chunker.output.encoding" select="'WINDOWS-1252'"></xsl:param>
  <xsl:param name="saxon.character.representation" select="'native'"></xsl:param>
</xsl:stylesheet>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Windows-1252 Encoding with Saxon XSLT
DESCRIPTION: XSL stylesheet configuration for enabling Windows-1252 character encoding when generating HTML Help documents. Includes necessary parameters for Saxon 6.5.x and DocBook XSL extensions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-22/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<xsl:stylesheet
  xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"
  version='1.0'>
  <xsl:import href="http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/htmlhelp/htmlhelp.xsl"/>
  <xsl:output method="html" encoding="WINDOWS-1252" indent="no"/>
  <xsl:param name="htmlhelp.encoding" select="'WINDOWS-1252'"></xsl:param>
  <xsl:param name="chunker.output.encoding" select="'WINDOWS-1252'"></xsl:param>
  <xsl:param name="saxon.character.representation" select="'native'"></xsl:param>
</xsl:stylesheet>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Invoking Saxon with Resolver Configuration for Windows-1252 DocBook Processing
DESCRIPTION: This command shows a more complete real-world example of invoking Saxon with Windows-1252 encoding support, XML Catalog resolution, and various XML parser configurations. It includes settings for JAXP factories and XML resolver tools.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
java \
  -Dencoding.windows-1252=com.nwalsh.saxon.Windows1252 \
  -Djavax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory=org.apache.xerces.jaxp.DocumentBuilderFactoryImpl \
  -Djavax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory=org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserFactoryImpl \
  -Djavax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory=com.icl.saxon.TransformerFactoryImpl \
com.icl.saxon.StyleSheet \
  -x org.apache.xml.resolver.tools.ResolvingXMLReader \
  -y org.apache.xml.resolver.tools.ResolvingXMLReader \
  -r org.apache.xml.resolver.tools.CatalogResolver \
mydoc.xml mystylesheet.xsl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Invoking Saxon with Windows-1252 Encoding for DocBook Transformation
DESCRIPTION: This command line demonstrates how to invoke the Saxon XSLT processor with the Windows-1252 encoding class. It sets up the Java system property required for DocBook XSL's Windows-1252 encoding support.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
java \
  -Dencoding.windows-1252=com.nwalsh.saxon.Windows1252 \
com.icl.saxon.StyleSheet \
mydoc.xml mystylesheet.xsl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Minimal Example of Refentry Markup for Man Page Generation in XML
DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet demonstrates the minimal structure required to control the contents of man page headers and footers. It includes elements for setting the date, title, section, source name, version, and manual information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-22/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<refentry>
  <info>
    <date>2003-10-20</date>
  </info>
  <refmeta>
    <refentrytitle>gtk-options</refentrytitle>
    <manvolnum>7</manvolnum>
    <refmiscinfo class="source-name">GTK+</refmiscinfo>
    <refmiscinfo class="version">1.2</refmiscinfo>
    <refmiscinfo class="manual">GTK+ User's Manual</refmiscinfo>
  </refmeta>
  <refnamediv>
    <refname>gtk-options</refname>
    <refpurpose>Standard Command Line Options for GTK+ Programs</refpurpose>
  </refnamediv>
  <refsect1>
    <title>Description</title>
    <para>This manual page describes the command line options, which
    are common to all GTK+ based applications.</para>
  </refsect1>
</refentry>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating DocBook Markup Structure for Man Page Headers and Footers
DESCRIPTION: Shows the XML structure needed to control man page header and footer content. The example illustrates how to set the title, section, date, source name, version, and manual information using DocBook markup elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<refentry>
  <info>
    <date>2003-10-20</date> 1
  </info>
  <refmeta>
    <refentrytitle>gtk-options</refentrytitle> 2
    <manvolnum>7</manvolnum> 3
    <refmiscinfo class="source-name">GTK+</refmiscinfo> 4
    <refmiscinfo class="version">1.2</refmiscinfo> 5
    <refmiscinfo class="manual">GTK+ User's Manual</refmiscinfo> 6
  </refmeta>
  <refnamediv>
    <refname>gtk-options</refname>
    <refpurpose>Standard Command Line Options for GTK+ Programs</refpurpose>
  </refnamediv>
  <refsect1>
    <title>Description</title>
    <para>This manual page describes the command line options, which
    are common to all GTK+ based applications.</para>
  </refsect1>
</refentry>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Timestamp Processing Instruction in DocBook
DESCRIPTION: Example of the dbtimestamp processing instruction that can be used to insert current datetime in a DocBook document. The format attribute allows customization of the timestamp format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-22/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<?dbtimestamp format="Y-m-d H:M:S"?>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Timestamp Processing Instruction in DocBook
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to use a processing instruction to insert the current date and time into a DocBook document. The format attribute allows customization of the timestamp output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<?dbtimestamp format="Y-m-d H:M:S"?>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Image Source Path in XML Processing Instruction
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the use of a processing instruction to specify the image source path for HTML output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-22/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<?img.src.path?>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Choice Separator in XML Simplelist
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use a processing instruction to generate a localized choice separator (e.g. 'and' or 'or') before the final item in an inline simplelist.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-22/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<para>Choose from
ONE and ONLY ONE of the following:
<simplelist type="inline">
<?dbchoice choice="or" ?>
<member>A</member>
<member>B</member>
<member>C</member>.</simplelist></para>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Choice Separator in XML for DocBook Inline Simplelist
DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet demonstrates how to use a processing instruction to generate a localized choice separator (e.g. 'and' or 'or') before the final item in an inline simplelist in DocBook.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<para>Choose from
ONE and ONLY ONE of the following:
<simplelist type="inline">
<?dbchoice choice="or" ?>
<member>A</member>
<member>B</member>
<member>C</member>.</simplelist></para>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Custom Choice Separator in XML for DocBook Inline Simplelist
DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet shows how to specify a custom literal string as a choice separator for languages without a localized 'or' in DocBook.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<?dbchoice choice="ou">
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating XEP Metadata Field in XSL-FO
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to generate an rx:meta-field element for XEP output to include the DocBook XSL stylesheet version in PDF document properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-22/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
<rx:meta-field creator="$VERSION"/>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring DocBook Titlepage Template in XML
DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet demonstrates the updated syntax for configuring titlepage templates in DocBook XSL stylesheets. It shows how to set attributes for the article element and its title, including font settings and alignment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<t:titlepage t:element="article" t:wrapper="fo:block"
             font-family="{$title.font.family}">

  <t:titlepage-content t:side="recto"
             text-align="center">

  <title t:named-template="component.title"
         param:node="ancestor-or-self::article[1]"
         text-align="center"
         keep-with-next="always"
         font-size="&hsize5;"
         font-weight="bold"
         font-family="{$title.font.family}"/>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: XML Info Structure Example
DESCRIPTION: Hierarchical structure showing the order of checking for metadata information in XML documents, particularly for man page generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
*info/productnumber
*info/productnumber
refmeta/refmiscinfo[@class = 'version']
parentinfo/productnumber
*info/productname
parentinfo/productname
refmeta/refmiscinfo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extra3 Field Structure Example
DESCRIPTION: XML hierarchy showing the order of checking for 'extra3' field content in man page generation, used for center header position content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/docbook/xsl/RELEASE-NOTES.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
parentinfo/title
parent's title
refmeta/refmiscinfo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking out OASIS TC SVN repository
DESCRIPTION: Example command for checking out content from an OASIS TC SVN repository. This is provided as a comparison to cloning or forking the GitHub repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
svn checkout https://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/svn/dita/trunk/doctypes/ dita-doctypes
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Ballot for Committee Specification Draft Approval
DESCRIPTION: Ballot language for approving XLIFF Version 2.1 Working Draft 01 as a Committee Specification Draft and releasing it for public review. Structured as a formal ballot with specific approval items.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/!Admin/XLIFF21Motions.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Title:
Approve XLIFF Version 2.1 Working Draft 01 as CSD/CSPRD
Question:
Do you
1) approve
A) XLIFF Version 2.1 Working Draft 01 from 03 October 2016 https://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/browse/wsvn/xliff/trunk/xliff-21/xliff-core-v2.1-wd01.html *.pdf, and *.xml and all associated artifacts at https://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/svn/xliff/trunk/xliff-21/schemas/ [Revision 70#] as a Committee Specification Draft, designating  the html version of the specification as authoritative
and
B) releasing the Committee Specification Draft for a 30 days public review and
2) direct the TC officers to work with OASIS TC Administration on all tasks required to carry out publishing of the above approved drafts.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Special Majority Vote Motion for Committee Specification 01
DESCRIPTION: Motion to approve a Special Majority Vote for advancing XLIFF Version 2.1 WD5 to Committee Specification 01 status. Includes reference to the specification, associated artifacts, and affirmation that changes since public review are non-material.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/!Admin/XLIFF21Motions.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
I move to approve the TC Officers requesting that TC Administration hold a Special Majority Vote to approve XLIFF Version 2.1 the 5th working draft from 08 August 2017 [labelled in advance as Committee Specification 01]  https://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/browse/wsvn/xliff/trunk/xliff-21/xliff-core-v2.1-cs01.html *.pdf, and *.xml (designating  the html version of the specification as authoritative) and all associated artifacts at https://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/browse/wsvn/xliff/trunk/xliff-21/schemas/ [Revision 96X] as a Committee Specification. I further move that the TC affirm that changes have been made since the last public review, that the changes made are documented in <URL for the summary of changes> and that the TC judges these changes to be Non-Material in accordance with the definition in the OASIS TC Process (https://www.oasis-open.org/policies-guidelines/oasis-defined-terms-2017-05-26#dNonmaterialChange).
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Motion for Committee Specification Draft and Public Review
DESCRIPTION: Motion to approve XLIFF Version 2.1 Working Draft 01 as a Committee Specification Draft, designate the HTML version as authoritative, and release it for a 30-day public review period.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/!Admin/XLIFF21Motions.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
I move that the TC approve XLIFF Version 2.1 Working Draft 01 from 03 October 2016 https://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/browse/wsvn/xliff/trunk/xliff-21/xliff-core-v2.1-wd01.html *.pdf, and *.xml and all associated artifacts at https://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/svn/xliff/trunk/xliff-21/schemas/ [Revision 70#] as a Committee Specification Draft, designating  the html version of the specification as authoritative, and that the TC further approve releasing the Committee Specification Draft for a 30 days public review and direct the TC officers to work with OASIS TC Administration on all tasks required to carry out  publishing of the above approved drafts.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Special Majority Motion for XLIFF V2.1 COS01
DESCRIPTION: Motion for requesting a Special Majority Vote to approve continuing with an OASIS Standard Call for Consent for XLIFF Version 2.1 COS01, conditional on no further comments being received by the end of the day.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/!Admin/XLIFF21Motions.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
I move to approve, on the condition that no more COS01 comments are received by 23:59 UCT today, the officers of the TC requesting that TC Administration hold a Special Majority Vote to approve continuing with an OASIS Standard Call for Consent for XLIFF Version 2.1 Candidate OASIS Standard 01 (http://docs.oasis-open.org/xliff/xliff-core/v2.1/cos01/xliff-core-v2.1-cos01.html).
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Special Majority Motion Template for XLIFF V2.1 COS02 Approval
DESCRIPTION: Motion template for approving XLIFF V2.1 Candidate OASIS Standard 02 (COS02) after addressing non-material errors reported during the 60-day public review period of COS01. Includes references to the working draft and error log.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/!Admin/XLIFF21Motions.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
XLIFF TC having received comments during the 60 day public review period of XLIFF V2.1 COS01, those comments having resulted in non-material error corrections and editorial improvements in the current working draft labeled in advance as COS02 (http://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/browse/wsvn/xliff/trunk/xliff-21/xliff-core-v2.1-cos02.html [revision 983]), and the corrections made being described in the error log on our SVN (http://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/browse/wsvn/xliff/trunk/xliff-21/%21Admin/COS01_CommentsDisposal/Simple-comment-resolution-log_XLIFF_2.1_cos01.pdf), I now move that the TC approve the above identified draft as XLIFF Version 2.1 Candidate OASIS Standard 02 and further request the TC Officers to request that TC Administration open a Special Majority Vote to approve submitting COS02 to the OASIS membership in a call for consent. By this motion, the TC confirms that all changes made were non-material and only made to address the reported issues.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generic Template for COS02 Approval
DESCRIPTION: Generic motion template for approving a Candidate OASIS Standard 02 after addressing non-material errors reported during the public review. Includes placeholders for document URLs and change records.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oasis-tcs/xliff-xliff-22/blob/master/xliff-21/!Admin/XLIFF21Motions.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Non-material errors in XLIFF V2.1 COS01 having been reported to the TC during the 60 day public review period, those non-material errors having been corrected in working draft 05 contained in <url to wd05>, and the corrections made being described in <where ever you record the changes>, I now move that the TC approve XLIFF V2.1 WD## as Candidate OASIS Standard 02 and further request the Chair to request that TC Administration open a Special Majority Vote to approve submitting COS02 to the OASIS membership in a call for consent. By this motion, the TC confirms that all changes made were non-material and only made to address the reported errors.
```
